text: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

text: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

text: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

text: I bought this to add to a herbal sleep remedy. I find that it works very well, it has certainly improved the quality of my sleep. Like most herbal remedies it takes a while to work. ( i don,t think that there are any quick fixes in herbal medicine)  The quality, i have used a number of tinctures from this company and they all seem to be of high quality, i have every confidence in them. As for the taste, most herbal tinctures taste awful. (why would anyone think it would taste nice?) However the taste is not that bad and is quite easily masked in a drink of some sort. If you are suffering with insomnia and/or anxiety, this is well worth a try. It is more effective mixed with other calming herbs than on its own though.

text: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called “glutamate” which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don’t feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you’re increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I’ve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.
title: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell

text: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.
title: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)

text: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

text: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

text: I wouldn't buy my tinctures from any other source, they are caring and their quality is top notch, I have tried several other brands and even bought for awhile from a person who makes her own, (not advisable bc of hygenics)...  Hawaii pharm has this down pact!!!From a hopeful, personal point of view...I successfully weaned myself off of opiates with the use of California Poppy..I was taking 4 pills a day for over 8 years!!..I decided to try it on the advice of a local Herbalist who'd owed a store for many years, I tried it, it took a couple weeks to adjust and make allowances for "extra pain" I didn't experience with the opiate, BUT, it is worth giving up more physical activity to not be controlled by a substance that 1) "knocks you out"..2) causes organ damage,sleeplessness, trauma (such as sweats, diareah ,constipation, vomiting if you cannot get it)...It is more like a "whole " body pain relief, not so generalized..and no negative side effects.( and my doctor is on board with it!!)

text: I have fibromyalgia and have avoided using pharmaceuticals as much as possible. However, about once a month, my pain is so intense that I need something to break through the pain. I decided to try this since it was touted as a more natural alternative to the codones...and man, has it been a life saver! I just bought some passionflower and st.john's wort in dried form from another source to use as a calming tea at night, since sleep deprivation is one of the biggest issues in my fibromyalgia. I'm excited to see how those will work together. But as far as this product - it truly has been a life-saver and I'm only sorry that I waited so long to order the second bottle!

text: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.
title: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)

name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

text: If you have liver problems, don't use it as it has Kava Kava. Don't use it every day either. With that said, I have to say that this extract is amazing. I put it into water and it turns into a cloudy white color. The taste isn't bad, but very herbal. Usually within 20 minutes of taking a dose, I feel very tranquil and relaxed and ready for sleep. It is really good for when I have to wake up early the next morning and can't seem to wind down early enough for bedtime. Before, I would lie awake for hours staring at the ceiling until the first sunlight started coming through the window, knowing I'd have to get up in an hour or so. Now when I need it, I can lay down and fall asleep peacefully. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs an occasional herbal sleep aid.
title: Don't use everyday. Otherwise it's excellent!

text: I've had amazing successes  with kava/poppy. My recent experiences were related to playing solos and juries (end of the semester tests/reviews before the music faculty) during my undergrad education--I majored in music. At this time, my anxiety was just starting to emerge into a problem. I took the recommended dose, on the low side, and found it did wonders to "take the edge off" and allow me to automatically relax my breathing and heart rate and not follow any negative trains of thought. It had a tranquil, peaceful emotional effect as well. But subtle.  One final note, I've noticed a more immediate and profound effect from Sense herbal mix tincture than from taking these herbs earlier in any form separately. Weird. May be this is because they were grown in Hawaii?

text: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.
title: Works!  Must have at all times...

text: It’s a Friday night, and I’m staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I’d tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different—a bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I’d heard these were supposed to be nature’s way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn’t paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity—who knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I’m not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I’d hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn’t feel groggy or out of it—just calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

text: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. 🙂)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

text: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me. text: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I’m not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you’re too wound up to sleep.
title: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?

text: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

text: I am a very light sleeper with a racing mind. My biggest issue is not falling asleep, but staying asleep particularly in the morning hours. My brain is so active that I can "worry myself awake". Very frustrating!The tried-and-true supplement I rely on is RidgeCrest Herbs DreamOn Zen formula. I take TWO doses because of my mind's ability to bust through the herbs and think myself awake anyway.BUT with this, I took two doses and slept very very soundly through the night AND morning! Yay! And I have vivid long dreams which I LOVE.The only potential negative, which I do not care about and do not personally consider to be negative, is that compared to the DreamOn Zen, it doesn't help me fall asleep. I don't have issues falling asleep, but I do notice now that something about DreamOn Zen helped make me feel sleepier and go to sleep faster.My new plan is to take one dose of this plus one dose of DreamOn Zen instead of two doses of either one separately.So if your brain situation sounds like mine, try this. And honestly I also highly recommend trying DreamOn Zen too.

text: I have trouble sleeping and know that what may work for others sometimes may not work for me. However, the Secret of the Tribe’s promise of full refund is what makes it a scam. After trying their product and finding that it did nothing for me, even after more than doubling the recommended dosage I tried to return it and ended on a chat that supposedly approved my return, but could not tell me where to mail the product. It told me to use the rerun address in my confirmation email, but there was no return address in said email. Then I was directed to call the customer service line, but when I did what I got was a recoded message selling me new products and subscriptions. And though I said I wasn’t interested I was transferred to said promotions, since it was a non interactive recording, which transferred to the promotional line regardless of my response. There was no life person to talk to. In other words I got approval to return, but was given zero directions or guidance on how to make said return.I call that a scam.

title: Amazing mood stabilizer
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
name: MaryRuth Organics, Herbal Supplement Drop, Calmness & Relaxation, Pack of 1, USDA Kava Root, Sugar/Gluten Free, Support Sleep, Calm & Stress Relief, Vegan, Non-GMO, 30 Servings
features: USDA Organic Calming Kava: An Herbal Blend to Help Achieve Homeostasis! If you’d like to help promote feelings of calmness and relaxation, this blend of 8 herbs may help. Ease stress and promote relaxation with this herbal blend including nervine and adaptogenic herbs.

Multiple Benefits: Kava Kava Root has been found to help with feelings of calm, as well as Skullcap Herb and Hops Flower. Additionally, California Poppy Flower and Passionflower Leaf may have sleep supporting effects. Lastly, this herbal blend includes traditionally-used Anise Seed, Schisandra Berry and Licorice Root.

Vegan Formula: Per Serving (1 mL): Kava Kava (Piper methysticum) Root, California Poppy (Eschscholzia californica) Flower, Hops (Humulus lupulus) Flower, Skullcap (scutellaria lateriflora) Herb, Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata) Leaf, Schisandra (Schisandra chinensis) Berry, Anise (Pimpinella anisum) Seed, Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra) Root. Other Ingredients: Organic Glycerin, Purified Water.

Easy-to-Take Liquid Drops: USDA Organic Calming Kava can be taken directly by mouth or added to water. Shake well before use. Take up to 30 drops (1 mL) 1 to 3 times a day, or as recommended by a physician or healthcare professional. Each bottle comes with 30 servings.

For Most Lifestyles: USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Vegan, Made in a GMP Facility. Dairy Free, Nut Free, Gluten & Wheat Free, Soy Free, Corn Free, Sugar Free, No Synthetic or Artificial Colors, Alcohol Free Tincture.
brand: MaryRuth Organics, Herbal Supplement Drop, Calmness & Relaxation, Pack of 1, USDA Kava Root, Sugar/Gluten Free, Support Sleep, Calm & Stress Relief, Vegan, Non-GMO, 30 Servings

text: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

text: These pills are a godsend they are narcotic-free and really help to manage my pain. The other day I was cooking up a storm and had been in the kitchen for hours, my feet and back were hurting. I took a couple of these babies and before I knew it the foot pain was gone, I felt good enough to go for an hour and a half drive and visit with my daughter (she was up late settling into her own place). Mind you I didn't get back home till 2 o'clock in the morning and I felt pretty good pain wise. That was my first time taking this supplement, now I usually take 2 or 3 at a time- once or twice a day- depending on how bad I feel, I have been diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. I saw that the Medical Medium has a California poppy seed shock therapy in his new Brain Protocols book and will give that a try soon.

text: This supplement did not help my back pain when my back went out so I'm not sure what type of pain relief it is capable of giving. However I do notice that when I take it I sleep for a little longer than normal. Sometimes it makes me feel sleepy and I yawn but other times it just knocks me out and so I only take it a little before bedtime. This is a sedative so use with caution. And consult with your doctor before taking. I got this because it said it would help with early morning awakenings. At least that is what the magazine article said. Sometimes I awaken in the middle of the night but usually can easily get back to sleep. So don't be surprised if you sleep longer than normal.~The Rebecca Review

text: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

text: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It’s got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can’t speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

text: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don’t travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I’m taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I’ve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I’m a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there’s still some energy to spare. I’m very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It’s very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I’m often working double shifts a day and I’m feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it’s not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I’m in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I’ve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

text: I got the one with alcohol, which was maybe my downfall. I’d already been taking Ashwagandha supplements as capsule and decided to try the tincture since my experience with the Lemon Balm was so pleasant. But that’s where I was wrong. The taste is so repugnant and lingers for minutes after unless you eat something super tart. If you try this I’d recommend chasing with a super tart lemonade or going with the non-alcohol version. I seriously don’t know if I can finish this product, as the thought of having to endure another round of this makes me vomit in my mouth a little.

text: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

text: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

text: I love this stuff. As a pediatric nurse, I take numerous measures to make sure I stay well and don’t bring any illnesses to my patients. One of those measures is a daily dose of high dose elderberry. I used to take Sambucus Immune, but I’ve recently started the keto diet and that particular liquid formula has 8 carbs per serving, so it’s a no go for me (but my daughter stays well on it)! This product is the highest strength I’ve found available in capsule form. I’ve been taking this product over 30 days and during that time, I’ve been in close quarters with several people with viruses like norovirus (stomach flu) and only once did I feel just a little queasy for one afternoon. I took a double dose that night and the next morning I felt at 100%. After that, I go ahead and double up when I’m knowingly around someone sick. Ultimately, I’m very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone.
title: Keto-approved! It works and no extra carbs!

text: ** UPDATED FOR JUNE 2017, scroll down to read ** Bought twice. The first time I ordered a bottle I got Liquid Phyto-Capsules, the second time I ordered I recived capsules that seemed to either have powder in them or the liquid has dried up. The date on the bottle says 10/19, so I'm pretty sure they're not expired. I've been taking them like I normally would, but it's just...odd, because I know they're not supposed to look like this (unless they've changed?). I will still order these, I'm just confused. Hopefully I won't get sick or anything, I have 34 capsules left and I take two every morning.UPDATE: 6/12/17So I ordered another bottle a few days ago and received the bottle, to which on the box it stated that it was a new and improved formula. The capsules looked exactly like the ones that inspired me to write this review, they looked like the capsules in the picture. So the company finally got around to making it official that they changed the formula, on the box. I can't say for sure if this new formula works better than the old one, as I was sure that they were onto something with the liquid inside the capsule. Oh well. I ordered the elderberry syrup as well (not the nighttime one) and I take that sometimes when I need the extra help and want the benefits of having the liquid. So I guess just be aware that there's the change to the formula. Too bad they couldn't have just made another version of this capsule and kept this one with liquid inside. But I guess they know what they're doing.

I like to think they do help keeping my immune system strong and in perfect working order.

text: I have an autoimmune disease called Sarcoidosis that affects my lungs.  I get a lot of mucus build up and non-stop episodes of coughing.  On a whim, I was doing some Google-ing and found the recommendation for black elderberry.  I of course headed over to my favorite store (Amazon) and found the Gaia capsules, ordered a bottle to give them a try.  Wow!  They seem work almost instantaneously to break up the mucus and help to suppress the coughing.  I don't need to take them every day but I have reordered them twice and will continue to order to keep them in my cabinet.

name: Gaia Herbs Black Elderberry - Daily Immune Support Supplement to Help Maintain Well-Being - with Black Elderberries and Acerola Fruit for Antioxidant Support - 60 Vegan Capsules (30-Day Supply)
description:
Primarily found in Europe and North America, black elderberries have long been used in traditional cultures to support immune function. Elderberry has an extensive history of being used during seasonal immune challenges. Regarded as an “Elder” plant in Native American herbalism, elderberry has been used collectively by many tribes as a tonic medicine and food to promote health and vitality.
Black Elderberry (Sambucus Nigra) is unique in providing both antioxidant and immune support due to its natural concentration of anthocyanins and other flavonoids. This Black Elderberry (Sambucus Nigra) product contains no sweeteners or fillers, and is just as concentrated as our best-selling syrup in the convenience of a capsule for immune system support on the go.
From seed to shelf, Gaia is deeply committed to the purity, integrity, and potency of each product. Since Gaia Herbs was just a seedling in 1987, we have focused on connecting people, plants, and the planet to create healing. We use only organic methods to cultivate more than 6.5 million plants each year. That same organic approach continues throughout our manufacturing. We use patented technology to achieve the highest efficacy of each herb.
We are a company devoted to transparency. We have created Gaia’s MeetYourHerbs platform, one of the world’s first and only herb traceability programs, allowing consumers to learn about and engage with their organic herbs. We are able to source premium ingredients so you always know what's in your supplement. 
As a Certified B Corporation, we are actively working toward building a more inclusive and sustainable world. We nurture healthy connections between plants and people by encouraging strong relationships and championing environmental sustainability within the communities that we work with around the world.

text: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It’s got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can’t speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

text: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don’t travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I’m taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I’ve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I’m a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there’s still some energy to spare. I’m very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It’s very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I’m often working double shifts a day and I’m feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it’s not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I’m in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I’ve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

text: I got the one with alcohol, which was maybe my downfall. I’d already been taking Ashwagandha supplements as capsule and decided to try the tincture since my experience with the Lemon Balm was so pleasant. But that’s where I was wrong. The taste is so repugnant and lingers for minutes after unless you eat something super tart. If you try this I’d recommend chasing with a super tart lemonade or going with the non-alcohol version. I seriously don’t know if I can finish this product, as the thought of having to endure another round of this makes me vomit in my mouth a little.

text: I habe been taking valerian for a while intermittently to help me sleep. The liquid works better and faster than pill form. I was so thrilled to fund some affordable ones on amazon because it's difficult to justify a trip to sprouts for just one item and I have 2 small kids to tote around. This is a great quality product. It doesn't habe the alcohol burn like some Valerian liquids do. It does taste terrible when you first use it, but it doesn't really bother me. You kinda ha e to experiment with how much you need, I usually use about 1/4 to 1/2 of the dropper to get the effect I want.  This is also good for headaches and for relaxing as well. It works well for me as a sleep aid. I take it 30 minutes before I intend to go to sleep and it works amazingly!  No groggy feeling in the morning unless I took too much, but it's not like taking a sleeping pill or benadryl sort of groggy. I've never missed my alarm or slept til noon with this. Like I said experiment with how much you need. A while dropper full was too much for me and I'm slim,  5'6, in my mid 30s, for a reference, if size plays a part or just show tolerant you are with sleep aids.  Hope this helps!  Gove it a try, I promise it's worth it for a good night's sleep!!

text: I can't remember when I started using this Valerian product. I'm not a good flyer, and that's probably the reason I tried it the first time. If you get a bit anxious about getting locked into a "bus" with 200 strangers and taken up to 30 or 40 thousand feet, I suggest you try this Valerian. You will probably have to try how much to take depending on your size, height, etc. I would suggest you try it out on the ground first. And of course you should always check with your physician, and check out any interaction possibilities with anything else, medications, alcohol, etc. I find it helpful for many stressful situations; but anything like this, herbal or not, is a very personal choice. I find this to be a mild herbal helper for all types of stressful situations. Also, I have not found it to be addictive. It's just there when I need it. Honestly, sometimes i forget to take it, and I learn that I was more courageous than I gave myself credit for. Do your due diligence checking it out for yourself first. For some people it is a great help.

text: I think that this works well for someone who is just starting to use rhodiola. We going a more concentrated form that works better for us.
title: A bit watered down
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2024
name: HawaiiPharm Rhodiola Liquid Extract, Organic Rhodiola (Rhodiola Rosea) Tincture 4 oz
description: Rhodiola rosea is a perennial plant of the high altitudes of the northernmost reaches of Norway, Sweden, Finland, Iceland, China, Mongolia, and Russia, and also of Tibet. It bears spikes of blue-green leaves bearing a single yellow flower that blooms during the brief arctic summer. The plant grows in areas up to 2280 meters elevation. Several shoots grow from the same thick root. Shoots reaches 5 to 35 cm in height. Rhodiola rosea is dioecious – having separate female and male plants.
features: Rhodiola tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients!

High Quality Rhodiola liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant!
Super concentrated Rhodiola rosea extract: dry material / menstruum ratio 1:3!

We strictly use only organic or ethically sourced wild harvested material, organic alcohol, vegetable glycerin and crystal clear water! Really the BEST Rhodiola extract on market! Made with love for plants and respect for Nature!
brand: HawaiiPharm Rhodiola Liquid Extract, Organic Rhodiola (Rhodiola Rosea) Tincture 4 oz

text: it isn't sweet like some others, but its not that bad. reading the reviews I thought it would be terrible tasting &/or bitter. It DOES taste a heck of a lot better than lemon balm in alcohol! I would describe it as neutral in terms of sweetness with a pronounced herby quality. For what I need it for, its great!Both bottle & dropper are glass.the 10:1 concentration is very strong; more than the 3:1 I used to use & way stronger than the 1:3 my neighborhood organic foods grocery sells. I cannot see throught the 10:1 in the dropper; it looks more see thru in the other concentrations, esp. in the 1:3the bottle reccomends 30 drops per serving which I've found is just shy of a 1/4 tsp (so about a 1/4 tsp measure full with a very concave meniscus)value-wise then, this stuff is a bargan.

text: This product has a significant impact on putting me to sleep. 15 drops (3/4 serving) gets me ready to pass out in about 30-45 minutes. I have always been a good sleeper once asleep, but my smart watch is showing I'm sleeping deeper than normal since I started taking the product. So as a sleep aid it has been phenomenal.I need to take about a serving and a half (30 ish drops) to feel the tension relief in my muscles, and then I almost sleep too hard and have a harder time waking up in the morning. A non alcoholic hangover if you would? hahaI feel better in other ways too but it is hard to separate if I feel better because of the product or because I'm not drinking alcohol before bed.My skin looks great, mood is improved, focus is good. All the things.People complain about the price point, and yes, for 1.2 oz $30 seems steep, but if you figure it replaces one alcoholic drink a night, it's already breaking even or saving you money.I put it in a juice and sparkling water drink, and I've never noticed a taste.I'm excited to try their other flavors/versions.

text: As I discovered when I was pregnant, there just is not a substitute for red wine. There are great AF beers and even mocktails, but they just can’t get the flavor of a great cab without the alcohol. Fast forward and I’m just trying to ease back on week day consumption (it’s gained some momentum since 2020) and this is not a bad stand in. It definitely tastes more like an herbal tea than wine, but it’s pleasant. I’m experimenting with adding 2 droppers full to some room temperature sparkling water and a splash of no sugar added cranberry juice. It looks pretty in the glass, tastes ok, and I do feel more relaxed after drinking. I would say if you’re hesitating because of the price, just go for it and play around with how to take it. It’s definitely cheaper than 6 bottles of wine.

text: There aren't many reviews for this product yet so I'm sharing my experience and the experiences of two other people I know that take this Cryptolepis because I believe that this is a high quality product that may help those with Lyme Disease or other infections.I was taking Montana Farmacy's Cryptolepis for Lyme Disease because that brand seemed to be a trusted source with plenty of positive reviews. I can't say that I noticed any difference while taking it myself. Fast forward a few months and someone I know was diagnosed with Lyme and asked me for some herbal recommendations. Amazon was out of the Montana Farmacy brand at that time so I searched and found this one instead. It's made in the USA and 3rd party lab tested so I felt that it was safe to try. This person had a definite herx reaction from taking this Cryptolepis.  The Lyme literate doctor that they see felt that this was a very positive sign that the Cryptolepis was working.I decided to try this brand myself and I can definitely tell that it's stronger and making a difference. It has a 1:3 menstruum ratio vs the 1:5 ratio of Montana Farmacy.  I noticed an increase in fatigue with this brand at first as it started fighting the Lyme bacteria. Now that I've been taking it for a few weeks, I'm feeling noticeably better and more energized even with a low dose.I've also recommended this brand to a second person with Lyme Disease and other coinfections. They were taking a different Cryptolepis and they feel that Secrects of the Tribe Cryptolepis is much better than what they were taking previously.I highly recommend giving this product a try if you're considering it. Just be careful not to take too much at first because it's strong stuff. Start as slow as one drop a day if necessary based on your reaction.

text: Shame on these companies for watering down medicine.I have a debilitating, deadly illness and I have been buying this brand of cryptolepsis for a few weeks now. I have spent a good deal of money with this company.. It has been high quality medicine. This is not supposed to taste good, it's medicine.I purchased two bottles this time. One bottle was their regular high quality, bitter, highly effective product. The second bottle was watered down and I could barely taste it. I need more of this immediately otherwise I will start having seizures, difficulty breathing, lose my memory again and much more. It is very upsetting when these companies water down their products that we use as medicine.So now I am trying to figure out how to source a large amount of high quality cryptolepsis root in order to make my own tinctures. I've tried a few different brands of this tincture and they simply don't work. This brand had been the best, and I buy it because it ships quickly. I can't afford to wait a week or a week and a half.So I'm going to buy it one last time, and if the next bottle is similarly weak and watered down, and doesn't really taste that bitter, and doesn't really help my health, I give up.You guys are going to lose a loyal customer to try and what, save a few bucks?

text: I don't usually believe in this sort of product. Often feeling as though the effects the people endorsing it describe are all in their head or that they are exaggerating.I can tell you my experience. I have had some sort of congestion for several months  that wouldn't allow me to get a full breath. It felt like I was breathing through a towel most of the time. I was coughing and producing some stuff, but it never felt clear. It seemed to actually be getting worse. I'm a singer and it also put a really bad hole in my range where I could sing above and below but couldn't hit the inbetween.I received this yesterday. I was skeptical, but the reviews were so good (including from decades long smokers) so, I filled the included glass dropper to the 1ml mark as there were not instructions beyond that I could use it 3 times a day.I squirted the substance under my tounge and held it there for a 10 count before swallowing.30 min later, (I'll try not to be too graphic) but I produced a larger than usual volume by a startling amount and this happened a few more times over the next half an hour, finally culminating in a coughing fit that ended with...A breath of fresh air that felt like I had been under water and finally reached the surface. Ecstatic doesn't begin to describe my mood.I took one other dose at the end of the day. This morning I was singing with only a few minor notes that were difficult BUT NO LONGER IMPOSSIBLE to hit. I feel like those too will get better in short order simply because I haven't been able to practice them.I was hitting vibrato I couldn't dare to try yesterday...it's not a miracle. But it's far more than I ever expected much faster than i could have dreamed. 0 doubt in my mind this product works!On top of that, it actually tastes pretty good. I would have eaten cardboard to get this result, and still given it a 5 star review. So can I add a 6th star?
title: Can I add a 6th star?

text: As the headline reads I have both generalized anxiety and panic disorder and I’ve been dealing with it all of my life. As someone who has been on many medications over the years with often negative repercussions I’m very much for the natural approach of diet, exercise, Therapy, and supplements.This is not my first herbpharm  tincture I first bought the chamomile and lemonbalm. I was already comfortable using this when I bought it I just didn’t realize how amazing it was for anxiety until recently when I started having crippling panic attacks again at the end of February. As someone who took Clonopin for more than six years, and then had to spend a year withdrawing and coming off of it I have to say this tincture gives me just as much relief. Without any of the side effects of withdrawal symptoms. That’s enough to be a win in my book. It’s reasonably priced it lasts a fairly long time you can also buy a 4 ounce bottle which I love as an option. I’ve known about this for years and like I said I’ve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however I’ve known about this for years and like I said I’ve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however. I originally bought this one for sleep. I have since ordered it two more times. I don’t actually noticed any sedative affects like some others have mentioned. Everyone is different And is affected differently so that’s important to keep in mind. It sucks to see the reviews bad mouthing these herb farm products for potency and what not. Your time would be better spent making a tincture of your own at home instead of writing reviews for products that work for hundreds of other people. I’m so happy I found this and it gives me hope that my anxiety and more so my panic attacks aren’t going to take over my life.
title: Liquid gold for generalized anxiety and panic disorder.

text: This stuff is now a staple and a "need" in my home! My first time trying was a gift from my sister, who insisted I try it! So, this is my second bottle, and I must say, I am impressed!It's not a "cure all" for anxiety, of course. I have chronic anxiety so I knew going in this wouldn't be a cure for that. But it has helped tremendously. It definitely takes the edge off, helps me to be able to take deeper breaths, takes the chest pain away, and makes my heart stop racing! I usually take it 1-2 times a day. With such a small bottle I try to keep it to a minimum and use it only when I really need it.It does not taste good, but I dilute it in a small sip of water and down it fast. Chase it with another sip of water, and done. It does not leave a bad aftertaste, especially when you drink water afterward.I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone with any form of anxiety. Like I said, it's not a cure all, but it does take the edge off!

text: I know for some folks this product works marvelously. But I’m a difficult case when it comes to falling asleep. If it worked all the time for everybody, then it would be more like a drug. I use other similar products, such as Puritan's PrideCALM TABS that contains Valerian extract, Passion flower extract, hops, and a few other ingredients. Usually they help, but not always. And in the day if I have tension, I prefer a cup of hot tea with half-and-half, even black tea is soothing.Some folks claim that passion flower induces more vivid dreams. Maybe it does. But that’s the last thing I need!

text: There's definitely a noticeable relaxant effect.The taste is... herbal, but not bad. I generally need a Trazadone to get me to sleep, and then I have to discipline myself into relaxing so it can work. With this, even more so than valerian, falling asleep is an eventuality more than a choice (although I used about 3x the suggested dose before I felt much).Like a lot of extracts, this has a heavy alcohol component. I put it in a glass of cheap bota box red; the flavor was very strong and herbal--I actually really enjoyed the taste but I'm a little weird about herbal flavoring in liqueur and wine, so don't trust me on that really.Bottom line, if sleep hygiene doesn't work for you, try melatonin on a strict regime. If that doesn't work, try it and Valerian. If that doesn't work, try melatonin and this.This is powerful in a normally adult way: you'll get sleepy, very sleepy. Nothing fun, just a kind of expensive alternative to waiting on insurance.If sleep I'd the goal, go forth. Otherwise? Just know this is a sleepy drug, not a party drug.

text:
I was prescribed this extract by my doctor to see if it helped with my hot flashes that were completely out of control. Within 2 weeks of twice daily usage they disappeared, yippee! As a side bonus, with continued use, it also seems to have taken care of heart palpitations I used to get around 3 am.m, upon waking and randomly during the day. My doc doesnt seem to think this is a normal response, but I will take it! I used 2 droppers 2x daily to have this effect, and the 4 oz bottle lasts me about a month at this dosage.Unfortunately I did not have as good luck with it helping my insomnia. I use 2 droppers ? ~40 drops at bedtime. Maybe more would show a benefit.As a side note, the extract works much better for me than taking capsules, even if I take the capsules apart and take the powder in some water.UPDATE Dec2014 - I found if I take 6 droppers half full at bedtime it works great on my insomnia. I just tried Gaia phyto-gels caps
  
Gaia Herbs Passion Flower Liquid Phyto-Capsules, 60 Count







  
  
    and am up to 3 at night with no success/sleepiness, so I may need to switch back to the HerbPharma liquid here.

text: I bought this as well as the Lavander oil from herb pharm. My friend who is a naturopathic doctor recommended me to pour three squeezes of each into my water/preferred beverage- she said 4 squeezes should be the maximum amount I use though. I decided to give this product four stars because for whatever reason, it does not calm my anxiety down ALL the time. Sometimes I feel as if it made absolutely no difference, whereas other times I DEFINITELY DO feel that it’s kicking in and working. That to me right there says a lot, because I have tried TONS of natural supplements before in the past to help cope with my anxiety, and NONE of them did a single thing for me & I'm not one to fall for placebos. I’m very satisfied with Herb Pharm’s lavander & Passion flower oils- I just wish they worked ALL the time. I feel like when I don’t take it after 2-5 days they work better. However, if I’m using it everyday, I don’t feel like the results are as great. Either way, something is better than nothing- definitely recommend! Lol

text: My acupuncturist recommended this blend, and I was worried it might leave me "hungover" in the morning, because I tend to be very sensitive to such things, but it doesn't at all! I'm in a stressful season of life and was having a hard time sleeping more than 4-5 hours a night, so I would feel really "crunchy" during the day, and then wired-tired at night. This spray has not only helped me look forward to good sleep every night, it has also "softened" my nervous system so even when I'm light on sleep (due to external circumstances now rather than internal ones) I don't get that crunchy feeling. I keep it next to my bed and take it nightly (along with magnesium glycinate). It tastes great! Like cardamom.

text: Desperately wanted this to work. I have lifelong insomnia and have a closet larger than a pharmacy filled with sleep remedies from homeopathic, herbal, Chinese medicine, sprays, essential oils, and at least 15 other types of natural remedies to help me sleep. You name it -- it is in my closet.  I can get to sleep pretty well most nights without any help, but I wake up at 3:00 a.m. and then am up for the rest of the night. Doesn't matter if I hit the sack at 9:00 p.m. or 1:00 a.m.  I am up at 3:00 a.m. for the day. This was approximately my 20th try at a natural remedy for insomnia and it did not work for me. I am writing this after using it for 30 days -- every night as directed. The taste is OK for me since I am used to Chinese herbs which are horrible to taste. But this did not work -- I was up at 3:15 a.m. every night -- so maybe it gave me an extra 15 minutes before I was wide awake for the day.

text: Skullcap is amazing.  I have severe social anxiety as well as anxiety for any other situation.  I was on anti-depressants from age 15 to 21, then I had a child and didn't want to get back on prescription medication.  I make my own gel capsules using the tincture and usually take one to two depending on the severity of the situation.  This does not make me feel groggy or fatigued in anyway, but i have heard that it can in some people.  In my opinion the feeling it gives you is sort of like taking a shot of alcohol, in the way that it calms your nerves.  I recommend this to everyone but some people are hesitant because it doesn't effect you the way prescription anti-depressants or anti-anxiety medication does, which is a good thing I think.  You really have to let your body "open up" and allow it to work to notice a difference.

text: I've spent the last several years working very high stress, technical jobs in startups. And ooohhh man does the anxiety just get worse over time. Over longer periods of stress, certain minerals in your body can be depleted, leaving you more and more anxious and stressed out. Obviously mineral replenishment and the restoration of adrenal function is your end goal, but that takes time.In the meantime, I've found that a few drops of skullcap when I've stressed out helps take the edge off. As with anything, overuse can be problematic and have side effects. But a few drops of this helps calm me temporarily. It's not going to have prescription strength powers..... but it'll be safer and have fewer side effects and issues on your overall bodily symptoms if you have milder bouts of anxiety.I also like to use this before bedtime to help calm my racing mind and get to sleep. My preference is valerian, but using that too frequently can cause it to use it's effectiveness. So I like to alternate out between skullcap and valerian, combined with hops, to actually get a good nights sleep. Enough sleep can help your body better manage your cortisol levels (created as a response to stress).  Out of balance cortisol can lead to a host of other problems, including weight gain.

text: I did quite a bit of reading/research on Skullcap, and the difference in American & Chinese. (This one is American). I started as per the directions: 1 dropper/dose, 3 times per day. I was feeling sleepy (pleasantly) too early in the day. I cut back to 2 doses per day, afternoon and evening. Still more sleepy than I wanted in the late afternoon. Now, if I'm not going out, I have 1 dropper before dinner, and 1 at bedtime. If I'm going out in the early evening for dinner or a gathering, I take only 1 dropper at bedtime. This works well for me. It definitely does feel somewhat "sedating", but in much more pleasant a manner than ANY pill. Plus, my favorite part is the feeling of refreshing wakefulness in the morning, no grogginess. One suggestion, I would avoid taking it at all if you have consumed any alcoholic beverages on that day.

text: I have tried for 3 years to get off Ambien sleep medication. I tried cuttapering back, but it never worked. Then I read about Skullcap, bought this and the loose tea, but I have yet to try the loosetea as this is so much easier. I began taking it, without lowering my dosage. I waited a week, and then I began cutting down my pills, each time taking that dosage for a week. What I noticed the first week and it continues this way, is I feel relaxed and sleep longer. If I awake in the middle to the night with any problems, I take another dropper full, but that is seldom. Last night I got down to just scraping off just  a little of my Ambien pill, that it was just psychological that I needed it. . Finally, I realize now that I can sleep without Ambien. I will continue to buy this to have when we take trips. This product needs to be advertised more. I found out about when I got on a forum where others were trying to get off sleeping pills. I have never had such good night sleeps and days where I felt energized. I have a new life.

text: I took this for the first time last night.  What a night!  I took it to help with sleep and pain.  I will say that it most definitely made me sleepy and I did find it calming.  However, for me it appears to be dangerous.  I woke up a couple hours after taking it.  I saw lights on under the bedroom doors (one leads to a hall and one to a laundry room).  It took me a long time to figure out where I was in the room.  I knew I was in the room in the bed, but didn't know where in the room the bed was located.  I then realized that I was upside down and half-off the mattress.  Not at all like me, I don't move much.  I got up and went to the bathroom and when I came back the lights under the door were not on.  I asked my husband who was in the basement playing a computer game and he said no lights were on to his knowledge.  So I don't know what happened!  I think I was half-asleep when I got up.  I ended up sleeping until 9 this morning but I have been groggy all day.  I should note that I am very sensitive to medications so it stands to reason that I would be with herbs as well.  But after reading about some issues with Skullcap and possible liver problems, I'm going to discontinue it.  Tonight I'm trying the Jamaican Dogwood.  I'll post about that one tomorrow.  By the way, I love Herb Pharm and have not been sick all year, which I believe is due to using their Mullein Blend.  I would not hesitate to purchase that one.

text: We use more than a couple supplements. It's not always possible to know how well each is working individually when taken with others. Over the years I have learned to use the label and the ad to judge the quality of a supplement. I use not only what IS there, but also what isn't there.Pura Herba GoldensealPROS:Ingredients are organic.No fillers or chemical preservatives. (None are needed as glycerin is a preservative.)Gives a lot of info, a lot that many should but don't. Pure Herba used dried root and a menstrum ratio of 1:3. I've made extracts and I really appreciate the information.In an amber glass bottle.Extract is made in USA, and the information is on the label. No looking through a miles long ad or posting a question to find out.$15 for 85 servings is 18¢ per serving.CONS:Uses the term tincture to identify this glycerite. Glycerites are made with glycerite, tinctures are made with alcohol, so when they put say it's an alcohol free tincture on the label, it's an oxymoron , a sign of either an uninformed manufacturer or the manufacturer thinking their consumer is uninformed. Both tinctures and glycerites are extracts, but the terms are not interchangeable. Call it what it is, a glycerite extract.

text: Goldenseal is a native plant of North America and has a long rich history of use by Native Americans who long understood the significance of this golden root. Rich in alkaloids mixed with flavonoids this herb is known to be antimicrobial, a natural antibiotic, anti-inflammatory and has many uses in herbal preparations. There are also concerns that due to its popularity, it is being over harvested. That being said this herb is a premier herb to have in your herbal cabinet.That being said, I can judge this bottle of Goldenseal only by the information given on the listing and on the bottle. It is said to be organic but is not certified and is prepared in the USA by Puraherba, a recently founded company out of Florida. Their website given on the bottle does not exist so it appears to be a startup working to get its products to market quickly through this site. While this lack of information raises some questions, I'm hoping that the information given about the product is accurate.

description: Graviola (Soursop) trees are bushy and low, only about 7.5-9 m tall. Young branchlets are rusty-hairy. The smooth, glossy, dark green leaves are oblong to elliptical and pointed at both ends. Solitary flowers emerge anywhere on the trunk, branches or twigs. They are cone shaped, the 3 fleshy outer petals are yellow-green, the 3 inner petals are pale-yellow. The fruit is more or less oval or heart-shaped, though it tends to be lopsided or curved.

features: EFFECTIVE MOOD SUPPORT: WILE Un-Anger Tincture is a 100% plant-derived natural tincture, ideal for stress or anger-provoking events. This herbal tincture supports a healthy stress response and helps calm the body and mind. Great for PMS and helps to reduce irritability, common in midlife. POWERFUL CALMATIVE INGREDIENTS: Infused with soothing Kava root, Milk Thistle, and other concentrated calmers, this tincture mix supports mood during anger and frustration. Kava promotes a healthy mood in response to occasional stress, known for deep relaxation and a calming effect. Milk Thistle helps improve mood and relieve stress, while English Lavender is known to calm the body and mind. Chaste Tree helps relieve physical and emotional symptoms associated with the menstrual cycle.

FAST-ACTING STRESS RELIEF: Get fast support during frustration, anger, and irritability with 1-2 droppers under the tongue, then swallow. These tincture drops have a sharp taste that quickly dissipates and may be added to water, tea, coffee, or your favorite drink.

NATURAL AND SAFE: Our mood support supplement is formulated by naturopath physicians with no side effects. Vegan, gluten-free, non-habit forming, and non-sedative, this mood support tincture promotes a sense of well-being and acts as a mood support supplement and flow drops for energy and focus.

MENOPAUSE SUPPLEMENTS FOR WOMEN 40+: WILE capsules, tinctures, and functional drinks help manage hormones, perimenopause, and stress for women over 40. Includes 1 fl oz. (30 servings). Take up to 3 times a day for menopause support, PMS support, and menopause relief.

text: The benefits of mushrooms seems to be becoming more and more popular lately. Using a tincture like this is a great way to get the benefits of mushrooms, such as improving the immune system, sleep quality and stress response. They're easy to take; just a few drops under the tongue or in a small amount of water or other drink. However, tinctures are not known for tasting good. They're usually very UNpleasant. But I find putting the drops under the tongue prevents the taste from being too unpleasant. It also allows it to go straight into the bloodstream. I started off with a lower dose than recommended to be sure I didn't have any reaction to it. And gradually increased to the full recommended dose.  I've been taking a few tinctures and have found them to be beneficial. This is also made by a small Canadian company which I'm happy to support.

text: I have been reading some research on Reishi Mushroom for a while, and there are supposedly a ton of benefits, including cardiovascular benefits and antidepressant properties. I decided to try the liquid and this particular Tincture (mixed with a little alcohol). It's easy to administer, the package says 4 drops a day (or 4 ml), which means this bottle should last 15 days.  However, in the product description, it says to use 2 drops, which means the bottle will last 30 days. Based on my research, I suggest going with 1 or 2 drops a day so that one can analyze if there are any side effects and act accordingly. Once you assess the situation you can probably increase the dosage (or even stop it completely). I'm starting with 2 drops personally and am interested to see if it will affect blood sugar and cholesterol/triglycerides.I didn't taste the drops on their own, but I added them to my tea, I didn't notice any change in taste, though again I'm using 2 drops, so I'm not sure if there will be a difference if one uses 4 drops. You can also add it to food, like a salad, though you probably need to make sure that you eat all the salad serving to make sure you take the dose that you are on. I have high hopes for this product and will continue to consume it for 3 months and go for blood work to see if there are any benefits in the area I discussed above. Though there are other benefits as described in the product description, that I will keep my eye on as well.

text: I love products made in Canada and even better when they come in a glass bottle. Includes a dropper (instead of a cap) and measurements up to 1ml so it is very easy to use and get the correct dosage. I'm a firm believer in natural products and using nature to not only sustain us but to repair us as well.It tastes surprisingly pleasant and while I add it to my morning coffee I wanted to know what the actual taste was on it's own and I'm happy to say it's tasty as well as a very light translucent golden colour. Adding it to my morning coffee the taste gets lost so I really don't notice its there.Promotes Better Immune System (which we all want) and Stress Response for a natural calm which in the busy season is a sure blessing! A win win in my book.I'm a little confused as to the dosage as the description says to take 2 dropper full's and each dropper holds 1ml so that would be 2ml. Yet the box it comes in says to take 4ml per adult dosage. And the bottle itself mentions a 4ml serving? So if I take 4ml per serving I would only get 15 servings per bottle. By taking 2ml per serving I will get 30 servings per bottle and if I only want to take 1ml per serving which for me seems reasonable I will get 60 servings so a 2 months supply. Anyhow which ever serving size you prefer to take I believe it will be helpful.I have a strong and healthy immune system as but the stress response for a natural calm is good as my husband says I'm grumpy before I get my coffee and as it goes in my coffee it's a win for both of us. I'm not so young anymore and finding something like this to help keep me calm, relaxed and healthy is great! Love it!Only time will tell as to the overall effect this will have on me and everything responds differently to different folks. But I've always felt mushrooms were good for me and to get the goodness in this tincture which is much more concentrated is wonderful!
