text: I really love this brand, they’re doing things right!  I can completely recommend the Forage brand and their tinctures, particularly the Lion's Mane and Reishi variants. If you read up about them on their site, you’ll see why and what I mean. The origin story and their work is awesome. Reishi in particular has an incredible history that’s worth reading up on. You can’t say too much about health benefits on sites in general, but if you take a look at it’s main uses, I feel this has been working to help things for me. I feel it has an ever so slightly minty taste to it. Main thing to know, don’t waste your money on any mushroom supplement if it doesn’t clearly specify it’s made of  fruiting bodies, and talks about beta glucans. I also don’t bother with supplements unless there’s an NPN number. Forage covers both of those angles. I also love the brown sunlight protected bottle, and the easy to read dropper.So.. yup! This is a great brand! Give em a try.

text: I loved this product the first time I bought it. The taste was pleasant and sweet, and the effects were relaxing. I purchased again and the second bottle was the same. Then I ordered a third bottle. When it arrived, sealed in its package like the others, I opened it and tried a dropperful. I nearly threw up. It tasted horribly rotten. Like drinking the juices from the bottom of a trash can. I gagged for several minutes and returned it immediately. However, I liked the first bottle so much I decided to try again. So I re-ordered and received another brand new, sealed bottle like the last. Guess what? Same horrible rotten taste. This time I did an exchange, and wrote the seller a note mentioning the horrible taste, and telling them I would not re-order a third time. Lo and behold, the next bottle I received was perfectly fine, just like the first two, with a pleasant sweet taste and calming effect. Thank goodness. All was well, until I finished that bottle and ordered the next one. Once again, I received a rotten bottle. I nearly threw up after half a dropper. It took hours to get the taste out of my mouth.  There were no odd or extenuating circumstances - the packages were well wrapped and safe, undamaged and not left in the sun. All three deliveries were in the fall/winter when temperatures were in the 60s or lower. There was no chance it went bad during transit. There is a huge batch of rotten product sitting in a warehouse somewhere, and they’re just shipping it out. Probably figuring most people won’t bother to return it. So far a I’ve had three bad bottles out of six. If you’re willing to take those odds, by all means order this product. You’ve got a 50% chance of having a very nice experience. Just be ready with a bucket when you have your first taste, in case the coin toss comes up heads and you vomit your guts out instead.
title: Horrible Rotten Taste - In Three Separate Orders!

text: I have had problems with waking up early. Deep Sleep addresses this some but by itself is not effective for me in that I wake up early still but maybe an hour later than I have (after I have become tolerant to other prescription meds I have been trying.)  If you try it, know that the first couple nights will be very strange, with crazy dreams - this is the best I can describe it. But at least this is not an additive medication. I have since added back the other prescriptions meds one by one and Deep Sleep does seem to potentiate their effect. I have reordered another value-size four ounce bottle from Amazon. It is not the alcohol-free version but that does not bother me and Herbs Etc tells me that the amount of alcohol in the whole bottle does not equal a half glass of wine, if I remember correctly. You might want to check with them directly to be sure, if that is an issue for you.

text: I've written a positve review before on the soft gels, so I thought I'd give the liquid a try, as I also thought it might be more cost effective.NEVER AGAIN !While it has the same potency as the gels, it has the most god-awful taste, akin to licking the inside of tarnished spoon...which I did as a kid and remember vividly.The stopper didn't work well either, not completely filling to the maximum, but only about half-way. I took two of these droppers half-full and slept soundly. Doing so seems to use a greater amount than in the gels, obviously, to achieve the same effect of three gels.Once I'm finished with this review, and even though I have an almost full 4oz bottle left, I'm ordering the gels again. Less mess, no aftertaste, no burping it up to haunt you three hours later, and a better value.PLEEEASE, Herbs Etc., at least add a little pina colada taste to it to make it more palatable.

name: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 2 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August.The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

text: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

text: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.
